original: Brändström, Hilding Konstantin, borgmästare, Västervik, f. 9/8/96 i Luleå av överlantmät. Hugo Konstantin B. o. Emma Bäckström. G. 24 m. Ingeborg Hagberg. Barn: Inger f. 25, Hugo 26, Hilding 28, Torbjörn 31, Ingeborg Gunilla 38. — Stud:ex. i Sthlm 11, DHS 13, res:off:ex. 16, und:löjtn. v. Norrb. reg. 17, jur. kand. i Sthlm 19. E. o. not. i Svea hovr. 20, tings tjg. 21-22, auditör o. krigsdom. tidv. 22 o. 23, tf. borgmäst. i Örnsköldsvik tidv. 23-28, egen adv:verks. där samma tid, borgmäst. i Västervik sed. 28. Sekr. h. stadsfullm. o. drät-selkamm. i Örnsköldsvik 24-28, fastig-h:reg:för. 26-28, ordf. i styr. f. Sv. Hand :bankens avd :kont. i Västervik sed. 29, ordf. i länsnykterh :ndn f. Kalmar 1., ordf. i Kalm. 1. gymn:förb. RNO 33.
translated: Brändström, Hilding Konstantin, mayor of Västervik, born on August 9, 1896 in Luleå to surveyor Hugo Konstantin B. and Emma Bäckström. Married on June 24 to Ingeborg Hagberg. Children: Inger (born in 1925), Hugo (1926), Hilding (1928), Torbjörn (1931), Ingeborg Gunilla (1938). He graduated from the Stockholm Gymnasium in 1911, DHS in 1913, was a reserve officer in 1916, a second lieutenant in the Norrbotten regiment in 1917, and earned a degree in law from Stockholm University in 1919. He was appointed a notary public in the Svea Court of Appeal in 1920, served as a court clerk from 1921-1922, was an auditor and military judge temporarily in 1922 and 1923, was acting mayor of Örnsköldsvik from time to time between 1923 and 1928 and operated his own law firm during the same period, and has been the mayor of Västervik since 1928. He was also the secretary of the city council and finance committee in Örnsköldsvik from 1924-1928, a member of the real estate registration board from 1926-1928, chairman of the Swedish Handelsbanken branch in Västervik since 1929, chairman of the county temperance board for Kalmar, and chairman of the Kalmar 1. gymnastics association. He was awarded the Royal Nordic Philanthropic Order in 1933.
